elements.title: Certificate of Incorporation Provisions on Capital Structure and Conversion

data.value: In the event of a consolidation or merger, distribution/payment for shares of Class A, B, and C capital stock is to be made ratably on a per share basis, except when differences relate only to voting power differences.
The Certificate of Incorporation prohibits entering into third party tender or exchange offers unless all classes receive the same per share consideration, subject to voting power differences.

On September 15, 2021, existing holders of Class B common stock voluntarily converted their shares into Class A common stock. Automatic conversion provisions apply if Class B shares represent less than 5% of the combined voting power of Class A and B.
Converted Class B or Class C shares are automatically retired and not available for reissuance.

Authorized but unissued shares of Class A, B, C capital stock, and preferred stock are available for future corporate finance transactions, acquisitions, and employee benefit plans, subject to NYSE rules.
Holders of Class A, B, and C stock have no right to redemption, additional stock purchase, or to maintain their proportionate interest, and are not required to make additional capital contributions.
The board of directors is authorized to issue preferred stock in one or more series without stockholder approval and determine the rights, preferences, and restrictions.
